intro: Pleurothallis spathuliglossa, commonly known as the broad-lipped pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that thrives in humid, shaded environments within the canopy of tropical forests. The plant features elongated, strap-like leaves and produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. Its flowers are typically clustered in inflorescences and are characterized by their broad, tongue-shaped petals. Due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements, it is a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts.
